abstract: Sanofi-Aventis, the French pharmaceutical company considering an $18.6 billion bid for the U.S. biotechnology firm Genzyme, said profits jumped in the second quarter due to strong sales of its diabetes drugs and the weaker euro.
snippet: Sanofi-Aventis, the French pharmaceutical company considering an $18.6 billion bid for the U.S. biotechnology firm Genzyme, said profits jumped in the second quarter due to strong sales of its diabetes drugs and the weaker euro.
lead_paragraph: Sanofi-Aventis, the French pharmaceutical company considering an $18.6 billion bid for the American biotechnology firm Genzyme, said profits jumped in the second quarter because of  strong sales of its diabetes drugs and the weaker euro, Chris V. Nicholson and Michael J. de la Merced report in The New York Times.

headline.main: Sanofi Mum on Genzyme as It Posts Higher Profit

byline.original: By Chris V. Nicholson and Michael J. de la Merced
